claim: Under GDPR, controllers do not need data processing agreements with processors because the GDPR imposes direct obligations on processors
Under GDPR, when relying on consent to process personal data, consent must be explicit
Under GDPR, everyone needs a data protection officer
The GDPR will only affect organisations in Europe
Under GDPR, controllers and processors will only have to answer to a single data protection authority
Biometric data are sensitive data under the GDPR
Under GDPR, individuals have an absolute right to be forgotten
Under GDPR, parental consent is always required when collecting personal data from children
Under GDPR, every business will be subject to new data portability rules
Under GDPR, profiling activities always require consent
Pseudonymised data (eg hashed data) are treated exactly like any other personal data under the GDPR
The GDPR will reduce paperwork for organisations as the notification requirement will be scrapped
Since my organisation is compliant under the Directive, there will not be too much work involved in becoming GDPR compliant
The UK has voted to leave the EU, so there is no need to worry about the GDPR
Self-driving cars are controlled by classical computer algorithms (if-then rules)
Self-driving cars will increase congestion in cities
Data privacy impedes IoT innovation and implies that IoT data cannot be collected
Privacy-preserving IoT is exclusively a regulatory problem
Privacy-preserving IoT is exclusively required to comply with data privacy regulations
Data privacy is fully preserved if IoT data is securely stored
Decentralized IoT (DeIoT) solves the privacy problem and provides absolute data privacy preservation
Driverless cars are ready to be sold to ordinary drivers
Self-driving vehicles navigate by communicating in real time with each other or with some central computer.
If I do not notice anything suspicious on my computer, it is not infected
There is absolutely no need for expensive security software. There are free programs that are at least as good!
Most malicious software is sent as an email attachment
My PC or network cannot be harmed by my visiting a website, if I don't download anything
Malware is most commonly downloaded through peer-to-peer and torrent sites
Visiting a porn site is more likely to result in being attacked by malware than looking at a page about equestrian sport
If I do not open an infected file, it can't do any harm
Most malicious software is distributed via USB sticks
I can save myself the expense of security software or hardware, because I know my way around and only visit safe websites
My PC holds no valuable data, so why would anyone attack it?
My PC doesn't run Windows, so it is quite safe
Malware is written by antivirus vendors
Blockchain is a magical database in the cloud.
Blockchain is free
There is only one blockchain
Blockchain can be used for anything and everything, or blockchains can be used everywhere
The blockchain ledger is locked and unchangeable/ unable to modify the data block once created, or blockchain data cannot be changed once updated
Blockchain records can never be hacked or changed/blockchain technology is 100% trustworthy, or blockchains are truth machines
Blockchain is bitcoin and bitcoin is blockchain
Blockchain is developed for big companies/ commercial communications only
Smart contracts have a similar legal value to regular contracts
Blockchain can store documents
Blockchains are intended only to aid money management
Blockchains consume high volumes of energy, increasing costs
Every transaction on blockchain is anonymous
All blockchains are public
The transaction fee of bitcoins is determined by the bitcoin wallet provider.
The bitcoin transaction is reversible and can be canceled anytime.
Blockchain technology is a finance, financial reporting, or otherwise accounting oriented tool
Blockchain eliminates the problem of trust entirely.
Any participant (anywhere in the world) can validate any blockchain transaction on a public blockchain.
The blockchain ecosystems are necessarily free of any intermediation (brokers, curators).
Adoption of cryptocurrencies in place of fiat currencies would eliminate hyperinflation plaguing countries like Venezuela.
Public blockchains are completely decentralized.
Public blockchains are more secure than private blockchains.
Off-chain sensitive data storage in a traditional database system is better than on-chain storage of data in the blockchain system.
Technologists creating "money" with algorithms and energy wastage is better than printing of fiat currencies in a governmental system with checks and balances.
Even if my laptop is stolen, my data is secure because my user account is protected by a password.
As long as a website looks official, I can enter my login data without concern.
I can identify a fraudulent website according to the lock symbol in the address bar of the internet browser
It is important for the security of my user accounts to regularly change the password.
A date of birth is a secure password as long as it isn't my own date of birth.

There is high reliability that something encrypted is going to remain untampered. It increases that reliability and the assurance that something that has not been altered or stolen or read or whatever.
Text messages and emails are more secure than instant messages.
Even if messages are end-to-end encrypted, they can also be read by third parties during transmission.
When I use a public Wi-Fi, other devices that are also using this Wi-Fi can generally see what data (e. g., passwords, credit card information) I enter on websites.
Private browsing would prevent hacking, as it would make the device hard to find by hackers.
Private browsing mode would prevent advertisements, viruses, and tracking by both the websites visited and the network provider
Private browsing prevents search engines from knowing my searches.
Websites cannot view IP addresses in private mode, thereby preventing geolocation
Even while a user was logged into a Google account, their search queries would not be saved while in private mode because private mode does not save search histories.
Bookmarks saved in private mode would not persist in later sessions because private mode deletes all local, temporary data, including bookmarks.
Government would need a warrant to access browsing activity from private mode.
Employers would be unable to track employees when they used private mode.
The government would be unable to track us when we used private mode.

With respect to preventing online stores from misusing one's credit card information, private browsing would be very effective because it allows the user to be undercover and out of reach of basic credit card hackers at online stores
A VPN protects me from entering my passwords or credit card information on dangerous websites
VPNs would be not at all effective at preventing observation by the ISP.
VPNs would prevent hackers from gaining access to their device.
VPNs would be very effective at preventing friends or family from seeing the websites in my browser history from my computer because I have my own private network that others cannot get into.
Websites that use HTTPS are trustworthy
Tor Browser would be not at all effective at preventing observation by the government because if the government wants to see what you are doing, they will see it no matter what.
Ad blockers would be somewhat effective at preventing the websites they visit from seeing their physical location

Tor Browser would be very effective at preventing hackers from gaining access to their device because the onion router is so deep and layered with basic protection it can't be used to maliciously hack
Websites can only determine their location if websites access it through the location API
Tor browser is most safe only when with a VPN and have it configured to use a proxy, since your data still goes through your ISP
If I visit websites that use HTTPS then other people that use my computer cannot see where I have been on the Internet
Tor browser is for the dark web and file sharing, it is the very definition of a dark web browser.
Antivirus software would prevent law enforcement from seeing the websites I visited
Antivirus software would prevent websites from misusing their card information
Tor is especially designed for criminals who want to make illegal business securely.
Tor has a backdoor heavily used by US law enforcement services.
Tor anonimize users completely
VPNs completely prevent data collection for commercial purposes
VPNs would protect against serverside threat
Reusing passwords is OK for secure passwords, but should be avoided for weak passwords
The inclusion of symbols makes passwords automatically more secure.
Private browsing benefits system security by blocking ads online.
HTTPS protocol could protect against phishing
HTTPS prevents people from seeing what their partner did on the Internet or the employer from seeing whether employees were not working when they should have been.
The lock symbol puts security in people's mind with the purpose to build up trust, this does not mean anything about the security of the websites or connection.
HTTPS is a bad protocol, if HTTPS were secure, I wouldn't need two-factor authentication.
An IoT device that receives security patches must not be secure.
Synchronizing passwords in a password manager increases their exposure to breaches
Password attackers do not automate their attacks, but perform them by hand
Work accounts have lower security requirements because the IT staff is responsible for security
Common substitutions (e.g. a @) make passwords more secure
Answering a message from a stranger can trigger a computer virus
In smart homes, only devices I actively interact with are able to collect data about me (e.g., the doorbell)
In IoT Devices, for collected data to be linked to me, I must have an account registered on the device
Most Iot Devices process their data locally and not the cloud
Most IoT Devices do not store their data
Receiving no security updates for IoT devices implies maximum security protection since there is no need for updates.
Biometrics authentication is a panacea for improving security of any system
The inconvenience of Two Factor Authentication outweighs its security benefits.
Cookies can be used to transmit viruses
Smart locks pose a security risk if because if I have my phone and am close to my door inside my home, my door will unlock
All IoT Devices store all their data in remote servers in a specific loaction
Biometrics in FIDO2 Biometric WebAuthn is stored on the server or in a remote database operated by the website
